ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 10 hours
6hrs
5 hours
I spent approximately 5 to 8 hours per week on this course.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Really beneficial and challenging. More discussion held by Teaching Assistant about the homework and exam could enhance the course even more.

I find the subject of survival analysis very fascinating and that was why decided to take the class even though it was not my requirement.I personally have to say the class was the most challenging and convoluted one I have taken so far. It was also difficult for me to keep afloat as the course does not offer TA sessions which I found very helpful for other courses. I have spent a lot of time on my own to read, search the web to get a grip of the problems.
Very useful for strengthening the theory background for survival analysis
Introducing topics outside of textbook.
Theoretical
The slides are too simple. Hope to have slides that explain the theory more clearly. The contents of the course is too much.

There were times when I felt like we jumped around from topic to topic without much cohesion. Also, I think that some of the lectures were not exactly relevant to the course and more relevant to the professor's research interests. The midterm was very difficult. I wish we had more homework assignments that were similar to questions found on the midterm, instead of questions that used SAS and didn't really relate to the theoretical nature of the course.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Shuangge Ma  Nice and inspiring.
Instructor: Shuangge Ma  Dr. Ma is very approachable, always ready to assist students with their questions.
Instructor: Shuangge Ma  Very knowledgeable
Instructor: Shuangge Ma  Very kind and excellent instructor.
Instructor: Shuangge Ma  clear mind
Instructor: Shuangge Ma  Instructor is going to too fast.hope he can stop more to give better explanation of the theory

Instructor: Shuangge Ma  There were some lectures where I had a lot of trouble following Professor Ma, but there were also times when he gave really great lectures too. His feedback was very good and prompt.

Instructor: Shuangge Ma  Professor Ma was organized and well-prepared for each lecture.However, I found it difficult to follow some of the proofs written on the board and was not able to find similar proofs or to develop a better understanding of them using the reference materials for the class.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Good and I will recommend it!

The class offered a wide range of theoretical foundation of the survival theory and its history. This is very theoretical course and requires extensive prior knowledge of probability, inference, delta method, theory of large numbers. I would recommend the class to students who had taken a few theoretical courses prior to that and who have good mathematical/statistical background.
Good
Yes
Essential but need your own efforts
I would recommend this course only to someone who was very interested in survival analysis.
I would only recommend this class to biostatistics students who had already taken additional theory courses and a course in applied survival analysis.
